meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.a: What Do Chinese Generals Fear The Most?

div.div: A rare inside look at what one of China's most influential generals really fears most.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SBlDAK&via=Digg&text=What Do Chinese Generals Fear The Most?

div.a: UK Court Makes Apple Pay Samsung's Legal Fees

div.div: The Court of Appeal of England and Wales has ordered Apple to pay the legal fees of Samsung after the company published a "false and misleading" notice in the wake of a patent lawsuit over the iPad.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/STtKeO&via=Digg&text=UK Court Makes Apple Pay Samsung's Legal Fees

div.div: WHEN YOU JUST NEED TO KNOW

div.a: How A Pregnancy Test Told A Man That He Has Testicular Cancer

div.div: Imagine the surprise of the man when the stick he peed on showed a positive symbol. The result, however, was what led him to find out that he had testicular cancer.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Q4s0km&via=Digg&text=How A Pregnancy Test Told A Man That He Has Testicular Cancer

div.a: In Kenya, Mobile Phone Credits More Valuable Than Meals

div.div: How useful can a mobile phone be to someone living on less than $2.50 a day? People will skip a meal or walk instead of paying for a bus fare so that they can keep their phone in credit.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZiUWpc&via=Digg&text=In Kenya, Mobile Phone Credits More Valuable Than Meals

div.a: How Much Would You Pay To Never See An Online Ad Again?

div.div: Imagine a $120 box that sits between your cable modem and your wireless router and blocks every kind of ad that can be delivered over the internet.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WNjpFx&via=Digg&text=How Much Would You Pay To Never See An Online Ad Again?

div.div: KLOSTERMAN TOLD HIM TO KEEP MUM

div.a: Did General Petraeus’ Lover’s Husband Ask Ethicist Chuck Klosterman For Advice?

div.div: Did some of the details of General Petraeus’ alleged affair ring a bell? Maybe that’s because it is awfully reminiscent of a certain conundrum presented in The NY Times Magazine‘s Ethicist column last July.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SWLlDB&via=Digg&text=Did General Petraeus’ Lover’s Husband Ask Ethicist Chuck Klosterman For Advice?

div.a: How Nickelback Makes Loads Of Money Despite Being Loathed

div.div: Nickelback is one of the best-selling rock bands in America, thriving as the recording industry declines. How it does so has less to do with the band’s artistry than with the commercial genius of its Jäger-swilling frontman.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RL54Dx&via=Digg&text=How Nickelback Makes Loads Of Money Despite Being Loathed

div.a: Remember TI-84 Calculators? They're Finally Getting Color Screens

div.div: In my day, we plotted quadratic equations in monochrome; who needs colors?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UrXbHD&via=Digg&text=Remember TI-84 Calculators? They're Finally Getting Color Screens

div.a: Romney Rapidly Losing Friends On Facebook

div.div: In the three days after Romney conceded the Presidential election to Barack Obama, more than 50,000 users have unliked his page.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VYwfL4&via=Digg&text=Romney Rapidly Losing Friends On Facebook

div.div: Herein is a parade of celebrities knocking ‘em down the hard way, including "Parks and Recreation"‘s Adam Scott and Aubrey Plaza doing it Hollywood backstage style and John Goodman with a pergola relay.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZdXbKv&via=Digg&text=All-Star Bowling Trick Shots

div.a: How Many Pictures Have Ever Been Taken?

div.div: We've been taking pictures for almost 200 years now, and we sure aren't slowing down. But how many pictures have we taken all together, since photography existed?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TkN3fG&via=Digg&text=How Many Pictures Have Ever Been Taken?

div.a: Remote Camera Helicopters Give Races An NES Look

div.div: This is a very cutting-edge way to shoot such races, and the end result looks remarkably like a higher resolution version of the classic NES (and other platforms) game Ivan "Ironman" Stewart's Super Off Road.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Zd1Tbo&via=Digg&text=Remote Camera Helicopters Give Races An NES Look

div.div: A concise infographic detailing the possibility of mining asteroids to keep the Earth supplied in some of it's most basic metals.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RJTzxS&via=Digg&text=How Asteroids Can Save Mankind

div.div: HATES THAT HAIRCUT YOU GAVE HER

div.a: 'Living Barbie' Poses For Fashion Shoot, Talks Doll Life

div.div: The Ukranian model became an online phenomena when photos of her doll-like features and Barbie proportions went viral around the world. Now, in her first major photo shoot, she opens up on her real life.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SJhVFx&via=Digg&text='Living Barbie' Poses For Fashion Shoot, Talks Doll Life

div.a: Photog Accidentally Captures Montreal On Fire In His First Time-Lapse

div.div: Photographer Evan Kitaljevich documented the blaze unintentionally in an uncommon way: through time-lapse photos.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ROSPG9&via=Digg&text=Photog Accidentally Captures Montreal On Fire In His First Time-Lapse

div.div: UNTIL APPLE SWITCHES THE CHARGING PORT

div.a: Top 10 DIY Repairs To Make Your Smartphone Last Forever

div.div: Instead of paying hundreds of dollars for a new device every time yours breaks, here are 10 repairs and upgrades you can perform yourself at home.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QwsUWN&via=Digg&text=Top 10 DIY Repairs To Make Your Smartphone Last Forever

div.div: VERY GRADUAL CHANGE WE CAN BELIEVE IN

div.a: Darwin Wins 4,000 Votes In Local Election

div.div: In protest of their creationist congressional representative, voters in Athens-Clark County, Georgia, threw their weight behind the father of evolutionary biology.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SIVJLN&via=Digg&text=Darwin Wins 4,000 Votes In Local Election

div.div: JOBS IN A TUX, FIXING A CAR

div.a: A Telling Encounter With Steve Jobs

div.div: Jobs had a reputation for being "difficult" to work with, or work for, but what was he like outside of Apple? Here's one illuminating story.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VktXLK&via=Digg&text=A Telling Encounter With Steve Jobs

div.a: Iraq And Afghanistan's Missing War Records

div.div: A strange thing happened when Christopher DeLara filed for disability benefits after his tour in Iraq: The U.S. Army said it had no records showing he had ever been overseas.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TRVtgD&via=Digg&text=Iraq And Afghanistan's Missing War Records

div.a: Watch What The Woman Who Had An Affair With Petraeus Had to Say About Him

div.div: Paula Broadwell made a number of media appearances earlier this year while promoting the release of her biography of Patraeus. As you'll see in the clips below, she clearly thought very highly of the general.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TQFa3B&via=Digg&text=Watch What The Woman Who Had An Affair With Petraeus Had to Say About Him

div.a: A Brief History Of Movie Title Design

div.div: This cool video pays homage to the history of logo design in film and will definitely make you want to watch some of these movies if you haven’t seem them already.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SX1dWH&via=Digg&text=A Brief History Of Movie Title Design

div.a: The Ridiculous Requests Ad Agencies Get From Clients

div.div: Ad creatives, designers, animators, directors, and illustrators have dressed up their favorite worst feedback from clients, transforming quotes that would normally give you a twitch, into a diverse collection of posters.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Ps0EnU&via=Digg&text=The Ridiculous Requests Ad Agencies Get From Clients

div.a: Inside Team Romney's Whale Of An IT Meltdown

div.div: It was supposed to be a "killer app," but a system deployed to volunteers by Mitt Romney's presidential campaign may have done more harm to Romney's chances on Election Day—largely because of a failure to follow basic best practices for IT projects.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Zfqs7y&via=Digg&text=Inside Team Romney's Whale Of An IT Meltdown

div.a: Can Wikipedia Predict Summer Box-Office Hits?

div.div: If you turned to Wikipedia for a pre-"Avengers" deep dive into the Marvel canon, you are apparently not alone. What’s more, your digital breadcrumbs might be a preview of coming box-office receipts.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/S5pLsg&via=Digg&text=Can Wikipedia Predict Summer Box-Office Hits?

div.a: Meet The Husbands And Boyfriends Of Victoria's Secret Supermodels

div.div: The job of Victoria's Secret model is a coveted one: the company gives the fashion show and models credit for billions of dollars in annual sales. Beside these powerhouse models are their supportive husbands and boyfriends.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SSTo34&via=Digg&text=Meet The Husbands And Boyfriends Of Victoria's Secret Supermodels

div.a: David Petraeus Was Brought Down By Gmail

div.div: How could a (potentially) hacked email account lead to resignation of one of the most powerful men in the nation? Why, if the account in question is a personal one, does it matter?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SWetKX&via=Digg&text=David Petraeus Was Brought Down By Gmail

div.a: I Was Just Friended By Myself On Facebook (And It Only Gets Weirder From There)

div.div: "I got a friend request from Bianca Bosker on Wednesday night. What followed spooked me: When I finally scoped out this new Bosker at 8:30 a.m. on Thursday, I found myself staring back at me."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Z0o6Kt&via=Digg&text=I Was Just Friended By Myself On Facebook (And It Only Gets Weirder From There)
